projects.description: An open source HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 caching proxy server that can be used as an edge cache in video streaming content delivery networks (CDNs) to improve scalability.

projects.title: PySceneDetect
projects.description: An open source tool that automatically detects scene changes in video files. It can split video content into scenes using visual metrics (ideal for preprocessing editing).

projects.title: Deep Video Analytics
projects.description: An open source system leveraging deep learning to index, search, and analyze video content (detect objects, faces, etc.), enabling large-scale video analytics.

projects.title: Doom9 Forums
projects.description: A long-standing forum community dedicated to digital video discussion, including codec development, DVD backup, video encoding techniques, and troubleshooting.

projects.title: VideoHelp
projects.description: A comprehensive website offering tools, guides, and forums for video conversion, editing, and troubleshooting, popular among video enthusiasts for its vast information on formats and software.

projects.title: IFME (Internet Friendly Media Encoder)
projects.description: An open source batch video encoding tool that uses x265, VP9, and other encoders to compress video files with an easy-to-use GUI, including options for parallel processing.

projects.title: AMD Advanced Media Framework (AMF SDK)
projects.description: AMD's GPUOpen Video SDK that provides developers access to GPU-accelerated encoding and decoding (H.264, HEVC, etc.) on AMD hardware.

projects.title: RIFE (AI Frame Interpolation)
projects.description: An AI-based method (Real-Time Intermediate Flow Estimation) for frame interpolation to create slow-motion videos by generating intermediate frames between existing ones.

projects.title: First Order Motion Model (for Image Animation)
projects.description: A deep learning model for animating a static image using the motion pattern extracted from a source video. Often used for puppeteering faces or objects (one-shot deepfakes).

projects.title: FaceSwap
projects.description: An open source deepfakes tool that allows the swapping of faces in videos using machine learning. It provides implementations of several face-swapping algorithms and a GUI.

projects.title: OpenPose
projects.description: A real-time multi-person keypoint detection library (pose estimation) that can detect body, hand, and facial keypoints in video frames. Useful for analysis or augmented reality.

projects.title: ffsubsync
projects.description: A tool to automatically synchronize subtitles with video by analyzing audio tracks. It uses speech detection to align subtitle timing via FFmpeg and machine learning.

projects.title: SMTube
projects.description: A lightweight YouTube browser that allows playing YouTube videos in external media players like SMPlayer or mpv, bypassing the web interface.

projects.title: Kaltura Community Edition
projects.description: The open source edition of the Kaltura video platform, which offers video content management, transcoding, and streaming services that can be self-hosted.

projects.title: Galicaster
projects.description: An open source lecture capture system often used with the Opencast platform. It provides an interface for recording multiple video sources (camera, slides) in classrooms or conferences.

projects.title: Opencast
projects.description: An open source enterprise video capture and distribution system, commonly used by educational institutions to manage lecture recordings, process videos, and distribute them to students.

projects.title: vid.stab
projects.description: An open source video stabilization library, used with FFmpeg to stabilize shaky footage by analyzing and smoothing camera motion.

projects.title: slowmoVideo
projects.description: An open source tool that creates slow-motion videos from existing footage by interpolating intermediate frames, allowing extreme slow motion effects.

projects.title: NVIDIA Video Codec SDK
projects.description: NVIDIA's official SDK for GPU-accelerated video encode/decode on GeForce and Quadro cards (NVENC/NVDEC). It provides APIs for developers to utilize NVIDIA hardware video codecs.

projects.title: Fraunhofer VVenC (VVC Encoder)
projects.description: An open source H.266/VVC video encoder library from Fraunhofer HHI implementing the Versatile Video Coding standard with a focus on performance and efficiency.

projects.title: Fraunhofer VVdeC (VVC Decoder)
projects.description: An open source decoder for the Versatile Video Coding (H.266/VVC) standard, released by Fraunhofer HHI for research and development purposes.

projects.title: Livestreamer
projects.description: The precursor to Streamlink, a command-line utility that extracted streams from various services to feed into a media player. (No longer maintained, replaced by Streamlink.)

projects.title: Tartube
projects.description: A GUI front-end for youtube-dl/yt-dlp on Linux and Windows that helps manage video downloads, subscriptions to channels/playlists, and metadata for offline viewing.

projects.title: Media Player Classic - Black Edition (MPC-BE)
projects.description: An enhanced, community-driven fork of the classic MPC-HC for Windows. MPC-BE includes additional features, updated codecs, and bug fixes while maintaining a lightweight footprint.

projects.title: Big Buck Bunny (4K UHD Demo)
projects.description: A short animated film by the Blender Foundation (2008). It's open content and commonly used as demo video footage for testing 4K, HDR, and high-bitrate video setups.

projects.title: Tears of Steel (Open Movie)
projects.description: A Blender Foundation live-action/CGI short film (2012) released as open content. Often used as test material for visual effects, 4K streaming, and encoding performance evaluations.

projects.title: Sintel (Open Movie)
projects.description: A 15-minute open source animated film (2010) by Blender Institute. It's frequently used for benchmarking video encoders and playback devices (available in 4K and various formats).

projects.title: Elephants Dream (Open Movie)
projects.description: The first open movie from the Blender Foundation (2006). It's an animated short film widely used in the past as a standard test video for new compression codecs and media players.

projects.title: SRS (Simple Realtime Server)
projects.description: An open source real-time video server in C++ that supports RTMP, WebRTC, HLS, HTTP-FLV, and SRT. SRS is known for its use in low-latency live streaming and is easy to deploy.

projects.title: RTMPDump
projects.description: A command-line program for downloading RTMP streaming media. RTMPDump was historically important for saving live streams to disk and has influenced newer tools for stream capture.

projects.title: Streamlink
projects.description: A command-line utility that extracts live video streams from various websites (like Twitch, YouTube, etc.) and pipes them to a player or saves them. It's a maintained fork of the Livestreamer project.

projects.title: AllPlayer
projects.description: A free media player for Windows with support for a wide range of video formats and subtitles.

projects.title: Apprentice Video
projects.description: An open source cross-platform media player focusing on high quality playback and unique features like alpha channel preview and timeline looping.

projects.title: GOM Player
projects.description: A popular free media player for Windows with built-in support for many codecs and a user-friendly interface.

projects.title: KMPlayer
projects.description: A versatile media player for Windows and mobile that supports various video formats and provides advanced playback controls.

projects.title: JetAudio
projects.description: An integrated multimedia player for Windows capable of playing video and audio with an array of sound effects and visualization features.

projects.title: JRiver Media Center
projects.description: A comprehensive media center application with high-quality video and audio playback, library management, and home theater features.

projects.title: Banshee
projects.description: An open source media player for Linux (and other platforms) that can play and organize video and audio, with support for podcasts and device sync.

projects.title: GNOME Videos (Totem)
projects.description: The default video player for the GNOME desktop (formerly Totem). It provides simple playback for local and network video streams on Linux.

projects.title: MythTV
projects.description: An open source DVR and media center that lets you capture broadcast TV, schedule recordings, and play them back on various devices.

projects.title: MediaPortal
projects.description: An open source media center for Windows that turns a PC into a complete home theater hub for playing TV, video, and music.

projects.title: Xine
projects.description: An open source multimedia playback engine and player for Unix-like systems, featuring support for CD/DVD playback and a wide range of codecs.

projects.title: OMXPlayer
projects.description: A hardware-accelerated command-line video player for the Raspberry Pi that utilizes the Pi’s GPU decoding for smooth playback.

projects.title: Doikki/DKVideoPlayer
projects.description: An Android video player library wrapping MediaPlayer, ExoPlayer, and IJKPlayer with features like preload, list playback, floating window, and more.

projects.title: Mp4Composer-android
projects.description: An Android library to compose and edit MP4 videos using MediaCodec, supporting filters, scaling, trimming, transcoding, cropping, time scaling, and rotation.

projects.title: GPUVideo-android
projects.description: An Android library that applies GPU-accelerated video filters to videos, integrates with ExoPlayer, and supports video recording with Camera2.

projects.title: Gaupol
projects.description: An open source subtitle editor for text-based subtitle files, featuring timing adjustment, translation support, and built-in video preview (Linux).

projects.title: Subtitle Composer
projects.description: A Qt-based subtitle editor for KDE/Linux that supports multiple subtitle formats and provides tools for timing, text editing, and translation.

projects.title: Kaltura nginx-vod-module
projects.description: An NGINX module for Video on Demand streaming that enables MP4 repackaging and dynamic adaptive streaming (HLS/DASH) support on Nginx servers.

projects.title: NodeTube
projects.description: An open-source self-hosted online video platform (YouTube alternative) supporting video/audio upload, livestreaming, and monetization.

projects.title: NymphCast
projects.description: An open source audio and video casting system with a client-server architecture, allowing media streaming to remote displays and custom application support.

projects.title: Peer5 HLS P2P
projects.description: Peer5’s peer-to-peer content delivery solution for HLS streams. It uses WebRTC to distribute video segments among viewers to offload bandwidth from the CDN.

projects.title: aiortc (Python WebRTC)
projects.description: A Python library for Web Real-Time Communication that implements WebRTC and ORTC, enabling real-time audio/video and data streaming in Python applications.

projects.title: Medooze Media Server
projects.description: An open source SFU (Selective Forwarding Unit) and MCU for WebRTC that routes and processes real-time video streams, supporting low-latency streaming and conferencing.

projects.title: coturn
projects.description: An open source implementation of TURN and STUN servers, used to facilitate NAT traversal for peer-to-peer video (and audio) communication in WebRTC and other protocols.

projects.title: Nimble Streamer
projects.description: A lightweight, free live streaming server supporting HLS, DASH, RTMP, SRT, and more, often used for low-latency streaming and transmuxing in production workflows.

projects.title: Icecast
projects.description: An open source streaming media server primarily for audio streaming (Ogg/Opus), which can also deliver video in formats like Ogg/Theora. Commonly used for internet radio and basic video streams.

projects.title: Haivision SRT
projects.description: Secure Reliable Transport protocol open source implementation that provides low-latency video streaming over unpredictable networks with error recovery and encryption.

projects.title: librist
projects.description: An open source library implementing the Reliable Internet Stream Transport (RIST) protocol for reliable low-latency video contribution and distribution over the Internet.

projects.title: ZLMediaKit
projects.description: A high-performance C++ media server framework supporting WebRTC, RTSP, RTMP, HTTP-FLV, HLS, WebSocket streaming, and SRT, for building streaming server/client applications.

projects.title: WebRTC Samples
projects.description: A collection of WebRTC demos and sample applications illustrating real-time peer-to-peer video, audio, and data streaming in web browsers using the WebRTC API.

projects.title: Deskreen
projects.description: An open source application that turns any device with a web browser into a secondary screen for your computer by streaming your desktop over WebRTC in real-time.

projects.title: PeerJS
projects.description: A simple peer-to-peer JavaScript library that abstracts WebRTC for direct video, audio, and data connectivity between browsers. Provides an easy way to build video chat and P2P apps.

projects.title: WebRTC-Experiment
projects.description: A repository of WebRTC experimental demos by Muaz Khan, including source code for various real-time communication use cases (screen sharing, peer connections, recording, etc.).

projects.title: BigBlueButton
projects.description: An open source web conferencing system designed for online learning that supports real-time sharing of video, slides, chat, and screens with low-latency audio and video.

projects.title: go2rtc
projects.description: A flexible high-performance streaming server written in Go that can ingest RTSP, WebRTC, RTMP, HTTP-FLV, and LL-HLS and output streams to multiple protocols (commonly used for home camera streaming).

projects.title: MP4Joiner & MP4Splitter
projects.description: Free open-source tools to losslessly join and split MP4 files without re-encoding. Useful for simple video file merging and cutting tasks.

projects.title: Light Alloy
projects.description: A lightweight, freeware media player for Windows known for its fast startup and support of all common video formats with configurable keyboard shortcuts.

projects.title: Content Delivery Video Library (CDVL)
projects.description: An online library of test video content and sequences provided for researchers and developers to evaluate video processing and streaming techniques (various resolutions, formats, and scenarios).

projects.title: FreeJ
projects.description: A real-time video mixer (VJ tool) that allows compositing multiple video inputs (live capture, movies, images) with layers and effects, controllable via command-line or Joystick (Linux).

projects.title: DVBlast
projects.description: A simple and powerful MPEG-2/TS demux and streaming application from the VideoLAN project, often used for broadcasting DVB streams (multicast or unicast) over IP networks.

projects.title: multicat
projects.description: A set of lightweight tools for multicast and transport stream manipulation (from the VLC project) – used for efficient UDP streaming, recording, and conversion of TS streams.

projects.title: CineForm SDK
projects.description: GoPro’s CineForm codec SDK, open-sourced, providing tools and libraries for the CineForm HD wavelet-based video codec used for high-fidelity video compression.

projects.title: Lagarith Lossless Codec
projects.description: A lossless video codec for Windows that offers high compression ratios. Useful for archival and intermediate video editing workflows where quality must be preserved (open source).

projects.title: UT Video Codec Suite
projects.description: An open source lossless video codec from Umezawa that provides fast encoding/decoding and is often used for lossless video compression on Windows (supports RGB and YUV formats).

projects.title: FFV1 Codec
projects.description: FFmpeg’s FFV1 is a lossless intra-frame video codec. It’s open, extremely efficient for archiving video, and is defined in an ongoing standardization (supported by archival institutions).

projects.title: ButtleOFX
projects.description: An open source nodal video compositing software built on top of OpenFX. It provides a user-friendly interface to apply and connect video effects (an experimental alternative to commercial compositors).

projects.title: VLMC (VideoLAN Movie Creator)
projects.description: An experimental non-linear video editing software from the VideoLAN project. Aims to offer basic editing (cutting, transitions, etc.) with a simple interface, built on libVLC.

projects.title: video4j
projects.description: A Java video processing library providing a set of tools and APIs to handle video operations in Java applications.

projects.title: scikit-video
projects.description: A set of video processing routines for use with SciPy, providing basic video reading and writing capabilities for scientific computing workflows in Python.

projects.title: Jubler
projects.description: A cross-platform open source subtitle editor written in Java. It supports multiple subtitle formats, style editing, timing synchronization, and real-time preview of subtitles on video.

projects.title: JCodec
projects.description: A pure Java implementation of common video and audio codecs (H.264, VP8, etc.), enabling decoding and encoding of media entirely in Java without native dependencies.

projects.title: libmpeg2
projects.description: A free library for decoding MPEG-1 and MPEG-2 video streams. It's lightweight and portable, used in several open source media players for MPEG-2 playback.

projects.title: MMAction2
projects.description: An open source toolkit for video understanding by OpenMMLab. It supports state-of-the-art models for action recognition, temporal action detection, and spatio-temporal detection in videos.

projects.title: Bento4
projects.description: A full-featured C++ toolkit for reading, writing, and processing MP4 files. Bento4 is often used for packaging content for MPEG-DASH and HLS, including encryption and manifest generation.

projects.title: fluent-ffmpeg (Node.js)
projects.description: A fluent API for using FFmpeg in Node.js applications. It allows programmatic creation of FFmpeg commands for video and audio processing using JavaScript.

projects.title: PyAV
projects.description: A Pythonic binding for FFmpeg’s libraries (Libav). PyAV allows Python programs to read, write, and manipulate video and audio data by leveraging the powerful FFmpeg backend.

projects.title: DTube
projects.description: A decentralized video platform built on blockchain (Steem/LBRY), offering an alternative to YouTube where videos are distributed via a peer-to-peer network and blockchain stores metadata and rewards.

projects.title: MediaCMS
projects.description: An open source online video and media content management system. It supports uploading, transcoding (via FFmpeg), and streaming of video content, providing a self-hosted YouTube-like platform.

projects.title: video_transcoding Scripts
projects.description: A collection of command-line scripts that automate the process of transcoding video files (e.g., using HandBrake/FFmpeg) into formats suitable for streaming and archiving, with sane defaults.

projects.title: DVBSnoop
projects.description: An analyzer and debugging tool for MPEG transport streams and DVB broadcasts. It allows inspection of packet structure, tables (PAT, PMT, etc.), and payload of digital video streams.

projects.title: MediaConch
projects.description: An open source policy compliance checker for digital audiovisual files (from MediaArea, the creators of MediaInfo). It helps verify and enforce file format standards and encoding best practices for archival video.
